thread.title: Blue ‘Toronto’ sign, bigger TV at Nathan Phillips Square for Jays game
thread.title_full: Blue ‘Toronto’ sign, bigger TV at Nathan Phillips Square for Jays game | Toronto Star

title: Blue ‘Toronto’ sign, bigger TV at Nathan Phillips Square for Jays game
text:
Toronto baseball fans can catch the Blue Jays’ AL Championship Series on a bigger TV screen at Nathan Phillips Square for Game 1 Friday night in Kansas City.
“Rest assured, Toronto,” Mayor John Tory tweeted on Thursday alongside a photo of workers setting up the new screen.
“The #BirdsNest screen is not coming down, we’re making it bigger for the @BlueJays in ALCS!”
Blue Jays’ fever has taken the city by storm, as the TORONTO sign was also coloured blue on Friday to mark the team’s first appearance in the ALCS in 22 years.
The Jays take on the Kansas City Royals in Game 1 of the ALCS at 7:30 p.m. tonight.
The series comes back to Toronto for Game 3 on Monday.
